column1: Darrin had dressed for breakfast the morning after
column2: but there were yet some minutes to spare before the call would come to the ward-room mess."My compliments to the captain
column4: Ensign Dave replied.Turning, he put on his sword and drew on his white gloves. Then, with a glance over himself, he left his quarters, walking briskly toward the commanding officer's quarters.Captain Gales, at his desk, received the young ensign's salute.On the desk lay the papers in the matter of the night before.Ensign
column5: I have gone over the papers in last night's affair
column7: as a naval vessel's commander is called, when not present.Yes
column8: sir?"The captain's face was inexpressive; it was impossible to tell what was going on in his mind."I have given careful attention to your report
column9: and also to that of Lieutenant Cantor. I have talked with Mr. Carmody
column10: and have asked Coxswain Riley and Corporal Ross some questions. And so I have come to the decision——-"Here the captain paused for an instant.
